intro: Trachyozus muricata, commonly known as the roughleaf spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. It typically grows in dry, rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Trachyozus muricata is adapted to withstand drought conditions and can thrive in poor soil environments.
